image.altText: A man and a woman walking along the street.

props.synopsis: Three men at the centre of one of NSW's biggest corruption cases are fighting to overturn their jail terms over a $30 million coal deal tied to a family property.

title.children: Obeids and Macdonald take $30m coal corruption case to High Court

image.altText: David Pocock

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's 2023 promise to fix a "building with buckets to collect leaks" remains unfulfilled, according to the National Gallery of Australia's annual report.

title.children: Pocock slams government over leaky roof housing $5b national collection

image.altText: Black-and-white picture of Ben Aulich.

props.synopsis: The Federal Court has found a Canberra woman was unfairly stripped of the value of her shares in two companies founded by former lawyer Ben Aulich, awarding her $500,000 in compensation.

title.children: Judge rules Canberra woman entitled to $500k after share dispute

image.altText: A woman with long blonde hair wearing a black blazer stands in a conference room looking serious.

props.synopsis: The Australian National University's dire financial situation is "improving", and interim vice-chancellor Rebekah Brown says the university has now set a new target of delivering a surplus next year.

title.children: Rebekah Brown says ANU campus 'a lot calmer' since she came on board

image.altText: Chris Steel talking to media outdoors.

props.synopsis: Five days after being censured in the ACT's Legislative Assembly for the bungled rollout of the territory's MyWay+ network, Transport Minister Chris Steel has issued a statement to "apologise to anyone impacted by the transition to the new service".

title.children: Sorry seems to be the hardest word for Chris Steel

image.altText: A boy does an activity at a table with his father.

props.synopsis: Liam used to dread walking through the school gates. Now, he can't wait to learn — but it took leaving a system that made him feel ignored to get there.

title.children: 'Terrible to watch': Why one family pulled their son from a Canberra public school

image.altText: An animated illustration of a man with a computer for a hear with moving clouds behind him.

props.synopsis: AI is creeping into every part of life — work, therapy, school, art — and Australians are divided between fascination and fear. We asked our readers if they were concerned about technology's rapid spread. This is what they told us.

title.children: 'Shouting at clouds': Australians struggling to get off the AI train

image.altText: A burnt out car with a gas canister in front of it

props.synopsis: A prosecutor has said a 35-year-old man deliberately rammed his car into pedestrians and cyclists on the French island of Oleron.

title.children: Driver rams car into pedestrians and cyclists on French island

image.altText: Erin Patterson with glasses on and head down gets into a van outside court

props.synopsis: Triple-murderer Erin Patterson is fighting to have her conviction quashed, claiming there was a "substantial miscarriage of justice" during her trial.

title.children: Seven reasons Erin Patterson says her murder convictions should be quashed

image.altText: A shot of an officer with blurred face and gaffer-taped device

props.synopsis: Seven people have been arrested in a months-long counter-terrorism sting in regional Queensland.

title.children: Bombs seized as seven arrested in counter-terrorism sting in Qld

image.altText: Two Ukrainian soldiers walking through a damaged neighbourhood holding guns.

props.synopsis: Moscow says it is making advances in the key city, which it says would allow Russian forces to claim more territory in Ukraine's eastern Donbas region.

title.children: Ukraine and Russia locked in intense clash over key strategic city

image.altText: Emma Powell stands in a dimly lit room with a wallpaper behind her.

props.synopsis: As thousands of Australian high school students sit their end-of-year exams, some have the added pressure of being homeless or living in unstable housing.

title.children: Record number of Victorian students seek help to meet educational costs

image.altText: A Shein logo in a department store with clothes racks in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The Chinese fast-fashion retailer opened its first ever physical store worldwide in Paris, only to be told the French government would be suspending access to its online platform.

title.children: France moves to suspend Shein over sex doll sales as Paris store opens

image.altText: A man and a woman walking along the street.

props.synopsis: Three men at the centre of one of NSW's biggest corruption cases are fighting to overturn their jail terms over a $30 million coal deal tied to a family property.

title.children: Obeids and Macdonald take $30m coal corruption case to High Court

image.altText: A young girl in a school uniform poses in front of a garden

props.synopsis: Parents of students at a Sydney school where a five-year-old girl was hit by a car and killed last week have demanded action to prevent another tragedy.

title.children: 'I got scoffed at': Parents demand action after girl's death outside Sydney school

image.altText: Victoria police chopper generic, uploaded April 6 2013

props.synopsis: Victorian Police Chief Commissioner Mike Bush, having already apologised for flying in the service's helicopter to Hobart, confirms he has travelled in the police helicopter on a previous occasion, as it is revealed his wife has separately flown in the helicopter.

title.children: Victorian police commissioner faces more questions over helicopter travel

image.altText: Latai Taumoepeau, a Tongan Australian artist in her early 50s, poses in the ocean, holding fabric above her head.

props.synopsis: The 50th anniversary of Sydney Festival — and the first from new artistic director Kris Nelson — features a mix of Australian and international artists taking over spaces across the city.

title.children: Sydney Festival celebrates 50 years in 2026. Here's what's in store

image.altText: Mike Burgess wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: Spy chief Mike Burgess will not name the countries capable and willing to assassinate their dissidents on Australian soil, but these are some possibilities.

title.children: Which countries could assassinate their dissidents in Australia?

image.altText: A non-identifiable child playing with toys.

props.synopsis: South Australia's childcare regulator has cancelled the registration of just one provider in recent years, while nearly 10,000 reported incidents have resulted in no action, FOI documents obtained by the ABC have revealed.

title.children: Nearly 10,000 SA childcare incidents reported resulted in 'no action'

image.altText: Dead marine life at Adelaide's West Beach.

props.synopsis: New research awaiting peer review has provided a few revelations about the make-up of South Australia's algal bloom, with a new predominant species — Karenia cristata — identified by scientists. Here's what we know so far.

title.children: What is the new species detected in SA's algal bloom?

image.altText: Karratha Gas Plant  2023-08-08 08:08:00

props.synopsis: A secret report undermines the WA government's claim that domestic gas production is helping the rest of the world decarbonise, while the state's own greenhouse gas emissions rise.

title.children: Secret report challenges government claim WA gas will help world decarbonise

image.altText: A large group of kayakers on the water, looking on at a massive coal bulk carrier.

props.synopsis: A Hunter Valley businessman is demanding recompense after the cancellation of a second cruise liner's visit to Newcastle amid safety fears sparked by a planned climate change protest on the harbour.

title.children: Furious businessman demands compensation from climate activists

image.altText: An aerial picture of rural Longford on a sunny day

props.synopsis: Authorities say $38 million has been spent trying to stop this town from stinking, but residents say they are still being forced indoors, put off meals and subjected to humiliating jokes.

title.children: 'You can sort of taste it': Small town kicks up stink as mystery stench lingers

image.altText: Russell Burns sitting and holding crutches with a blue background.

props.synopsis: Russell Burns is waiting on a mobility scooter worth $6,000 so he can leave the house, but says the business has "disappeared into the blue".

title.children: Outback residents in limbo as mobility equipment business disappears

image.altText: An aeroplane looks microscopic when silhouetted by a supermoon.

props.synopsis: The difference from other full moons won't be all that noticeable to the naked eye, but you can enhance the viewing experience if you pick the right time and vantage point.

title.children: The 'beaver' full moon will be the the closest supermoon of the year. Here's how to see it

image.altText: Venus Williams smiles on court

props.synopsis: Venus Williams is to start her 33rd straight season in women's tennis at the Auckland Classic, with another Australian Open appearance for the 45-year-old now a possibility.

title.children: Venus Williams set for potential Australian Open appearance

image.altText: Jess Jonassen looks to one side

props.synopsis: Jess Jonassen is not holding her breath for an Australian recall, but the Brisbane Heat captain believes she can still contribute at the international level.

title.children: Jonassen hopes for recall as WBBL milestone looms

image.altText: Troops wearing camouflage and white hats standing next to a cage.

props.synopsis: In September, the government relaxed gun rules to make it easier for hunters to shoot bears in urban areas.

title.children: Japan deploys troops to trap bears after record wave of attacks and deaths

image.altText: Prince William and Princess Catherine turn around to look at Prince Andrew

props.synopsis: King Charles III's move to strip Andrew of all his titles and boot him out of his sprawling Windsor Park palace was a defining moment, but some say the former prince is getting off too lightly.

title.children: Andrew's exile isn't enough for some critics. Here's what could come next

image.altText: A penguin flaps its wings on the sand at Gabo Island

props.synopsis: A re-establishing little penguin colony, once locally extinct, is finding its feet on the NSW far south coast.

title.children: World's smallest penguins return to coastal hamlet after 30-year disappearance

image.altText: Silver letters on a large white courthouse read: Supreme Court

props.synopsis: Evidence has concluded in the three-day murder trial of a man who fatally stabbed his wife following an argument in a Northern Territory remote community.

title.children: Court hears accused lacked 'murderous intent' when fatally stabbing wife

image.altText: A woman in a red cap and white t-short with fake blood on her neck.

props.synopsis: The boss of the Perth Football League urges clubs to treat the suspension of Osborne Park FC over an end-of-season costume stunt as a "line in the sand moment" for their culture.

title.children: Football club fined for Charlie Kirk costume amid Osborne Park FC ban

image.altText: An Asian Giant Hornet wearing a tracking device

props.synopsis: An American teacher and his teenage son die after being stung more than 100 times by a swarm of hornets while climbing down a tree after zip-lining at a resort in Laos.

title.children: Father and son killed by 'murder hornets' during Laos holiday

image.altText: A hand holding severed fibre cables.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating damage to a communications tower in the NSW Hunter region after calls to triple-0 were impacted by an Optus outage.

title.children: Triple-0 calls hit by Optus mobile outage leaving 34,000 without service

image.altText: Amna smiles with the red desert behind her.

props.synopsis: Being in the middle of nowhere, you learn what really matters. You find yourself experiencing things with unbridled passion, without shame or second-guessing.

title.children: Moving to the outback gave me courage to do things I never dreamed of
